intro: Phacelia ivesiana f. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture due to the presence of glandular hairs. This variety is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
